skillTree.localised_description: The dread steeds of Chaos are more than mere horses, but creatures tainted by Daemon blood, said to be gifts from the Dark Gods themselves.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

A unit with the Mark of Tzeentch has:
	➕  Barrier
	➕  Magical Attacks

skillTree.localised_description: A vast, mobile altar allows the souls of the slain to be ritualistically condemned directly from the field of slaughter.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

A unit with the Mark of Tzeentch has:
	➕  Barrier
	➕  Magical Attacks

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.
Summons a unit of Pink Horrors
Summons a unit of Pink Horrors

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +1 for "Gate of Tzeentch"

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Pink Horrors

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +2 for "Gate of Tzeentch"

skillTree.localised_description: With just a wave of the hand, projectiles fired at this servant of Tchar are turned from sharp and pointy to soft and entirely harmless.

Perhaps it is the Fly Lord's apparent nonchalance that enrages Tzeentch so? Whatever the reason, the Great Game's greatest player, and his greatest servant, have an adversary on which to focus their ire.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Nurglish factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Nurglish factions

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Whether it be training harder, travelling lighter, eating less or sleeping better, there's always a way to draw more from the day.

effects.description: Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 5%
Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 10%
Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: The locals take notice and will be inspired or frightened into action.

effects.description: Spread Corruption action: Tzeentch corruption is increased by an additional 1
Spread Corruption action: Tzeentch corruption is increased by an additional 2
Spread Corruption action: Tzeentch corruption is increased by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: They cannot stop what they cannot see.

effects.description: Damage Walls action: 1 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 2 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 3 additional wall breaches

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

effects.description: Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -10%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -20%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -40%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

A unit with the Mark of Tzeentch has:
	➕  Barrier
	➕  Magical Attacks

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description: Greatly reduced chance of being detected while in ambush stance

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Well built, robust. Powerful.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +10% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Blessed with the transformative boons of Tzeeneth, this one can travel further by his feathered wings, whether they be figurative or literal.
This one has become the conduit through which the Great Conspirator weaves His sorcerous webs, affecting glorious Change through magical means.

effects.description:
Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +10%
	(local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This one seeks to sow the seeds of confusion, dissent and dishonesty, for such are the insidious ways of the Changer.
"Are you the Gatekeeper?"

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This hero excels at channeling base magic from the Empyrean to its allies, though quantity over quality is a method with poor utility for wizardry.
Volley fire exercises with this hero ensure that ranged firepower is brought to bear, accurately and efficiently, at any range.
Excess magic is repurposed into a powerful enchant over the army, protecting them under Tzeentch's chromatic wings.

effects.description:
Barrier health: +200 for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A talent for commanding Aqshy offers this sorcerer surprising utility on the battlefield, excelling at destroying fortified positions.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Piercing Bolts of Burning"

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The sight of a massive flaming skull screaming across the battlefield can bend or break lines other magic would fail to impact.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Burning Head"

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A bit of an odd duck among his allies, this hero specializes in supporting human infantry, granting them the versatility to take on all comers.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Flaming Sword of Rhuin"

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The devastating power of a colossal comet of dark magic is hard to deny, for onlookers and victims alike.
Spinning a fragment of the winds of Shyish into spells is dangerous work, but allows the caster to regain a surprising volume of magic in their aftermath.
Dhar is the combination of all eight winds of magic - chaotic and destructive. A useful tool nonetheless, or perhaps because of that, for those seeking destruction.
Aqshy and warpfire are but two sides of the same coin, and this one is the metal in between.
Power is measured by success; any amount of risk can be justified with results.
A stellar sorcerer, potent and precise. They may not excel at any one thing, but their control over spells is never found wanting.

effects.description: Passive ability: Heart of the Storm

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A natural talent for manipulating the Winds helps surround this one in sorcerous power, a useful tool for themselves or others wishing to benefit from it.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
	(own army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Snapping from one spell to the next at breakneck speeds betrays the truth of practiced precision rather than careless concantenation.
Bending the winds effectively, without wasting a mote of energy, is the essence of superior sorcery.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -15% for all spells
